DOC.brief_summary: Study 0015 (NCT00107952) compares the safety and effectiveness of an investigational drug, telavancin, with vancomycin for the treatment of hospital-acquired pneumonia.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Telavancin and Vancomycin for Hospital-acquired Pneumonia Due to Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus Aureus
DOC.criteria: Clinical signs and symptoms consistent with pneumonia acquired after at least 48 hours of continuous stay in an inpatient acute or chronic care facility or acquired within 7 days after being discharged from a hospitalization of greater than or equal to 3 days duration. Received more than 24 hours of potentially effective systemic (IV, IM or PO) antibiotic therapy for Grampositive pneumonia immediately prior to randomization
